title: Welcome to the damage meta so far.
body:
I really don't feel like elaborating about why except one sentence but I'm going to anyways.  
Runes and lethality. Ever since the beginning of preseason, certain picks have emerged with rune combinations that basically break the champion. Klepto and {{champion:41}} , Predator and any movement based assaissn. E.g {{champion:107}} {{champion:120}} {{champion:141}} and Don't get me started on eletrocute. "We nerfed thunderlords two seasons ago, oh look we need a new rune. HOW ABOUT WE BRING BACK THUNDERLORDS" "But sir, people will know" "Then call it something esle" I'm not bitching about how I'm terrible or teammates troll me. I'm talking about the game itself.  It's not fun to play when the same picks come out beating you no matter what. The ways to counter picks don't exist like they used to. Taking loads of damage? Build armour. Opponenet builds lethality and armour pen and whoops, you should have bought damage instead at this point.

replies.body:
I agree with you here, the game is no fun when everyone one-hits everyone else.

Personally I still don't understand the purpose of lethality on all these assassin items.
The whole point of assassins is that they can delete squishies with their burst, but lack the sustained damage to deal with tanks and their armour/mr.

But squishies don't build armour, so therefore the only point of having lethality is to make assassins better against tanks, which is supposed to be their greatest counter?

If you must put lethality on something, put lethality on sustained damage items like Phantom Dancer or something, don't give it to burst items like Duskblade..

The only counter to damage at this point, is more damage.
Which is why you don't see much Nautilus or Rammus or other true tanks anymore, its all Vi or Shyv and all those _'tanks'_ that have enough damage to shred anyone.

_(sigh)_
This meta is still better than tank meta though, thank god it is gone

Except tank meta wasn't about actual tanks, it was certain assassins with high %health damage building tank.

While real tanks were being melted within seconds by everyone else.
So no one was playing real tanks.

No way, tank meta's are way better then damage meta's, because at least there is more counter-play in proper tank meta's.

Assassin meta's are about being 1-shot with as little counterplay as possible.
nautilus is good though? Naut has some of the highest damage for a true tank, alongside sion, and they're both really good at abusing sorcery+resolve.

Oh Naut is a great champ, so is Rammus.

the thing is, Darius is 80% as tanky as naut, but has 400% more damage.
So for a little bit less tankiness you get the chance to pretty much 1 hit an entire team.

Thats a compromise most people would _(and do)_ take.

Back in the good ol days, you used to play nautilus almost exclusively for his CC and unkillability. But now _(even you used it in your example to show how good he is)_ its all about damage.

the damage thing isn't entirely true, early levels before items, naut has very high base damages, if you think you can go toe to toe with naut early you're in for a bad time. Yeah sure the matchup becomes horrible after darius gets his cleaver, but people underestimate how much kill pressure a naut can bring to early lane with a doran's blade or ring.

Naut's early laning is held back by mana pool, but it is quite possible to bully a darius/fiora/garen/swain out of lane for the first few levels at the cost of a bit of mana and the risk of a gank. The hard bit is explaining to your team why you can't 1v1 a 0-4 fiora later on, and why you need to be grouped for most of the rest of the match.

Naut can beat alot of his 'counters' by playing aggressive before items, and after he plays safe and farms till he scales as a teamfight menace, being both tanky with decent consistent aoe damage, engage, pick potential, distruption and amazing cc. A fed nautilus, whilst not very menacing as a 1v1 opponent, can and *will* just dive into the enemy team, and with his w spam for a %hp shield, he's just going to sit there and not die.

You're missing my point,

The argument for playing Nautilus shouldn't be _"He's got lots of damage"_, he's a fricken tank, he shouldn't have ANY damage, the reason you should play him is for his CC and tankiness.

Its this whole damage meta that screws over our whole view of champs, instead of thinking _"Oh ill help my team by being a CC monster"_, you're thinking _"Ill smash them early with my damage!"_.

You know armor is most effective the less there is, like its more worth your money the less there is, so building lethality does insane amounts of damage to squishies due to it removing more percentage mitigation. dealing close to true damage to them so its very good to build into squishies

I only play ARAM, but you can come up against a 5 AD champ team as a tank, build nothing but armour and health, and still just melt in 2 seconds flat.

At least a tank meta is a fun game, not just 100-0 in under a second. It's brawling for ages, seeing who can out-heal others while dealing damage. THAT'S FUCKING FUN! Getting nuked 100-0 in half a second from an enemy you can't even see isn't a fun game.

I find myself playing less and less LoL these days, I may just take a break for a few months until they fix this retarded shit.

#bringbackseason2 (is this what the kids say? I don't do social media)
Oh yeah, tanks suck right now, because you can be all the tank you want, AD/AP builds their pen items, and your fucking useless now.

{{champion:142}}  <--------------- this C U N T still hasn't been nerfed in terms of damage

I don't care about any other champ atm, just nerf Zoe.

No one seems to actually pay attention that the Klepto rune is for supports, and thus the tree has nothing that really helps Gangplank or certain others that take it.
Yes, they get a speedy advantage on gold and some consumables, but overall their damage suffers in the long play.

You can't complain about an assassin doing what an assassin is meant to do, there are plenty of ways to counter them, ranging from CC, to damage negating items depending on what you're playing.
Are you an ADC? Then get {{item:3046}} {{item:3812}} you'll be tanky enough to survive any assassin, especially if your support brings {{summoner:3}} .

I find Electrocute to be very very niche.
Not many champions can hit the requirements for it.
Where thunderlords was simply hit three attacks, this is hit three attacks within a time limit.

>Yes, they get a speedy advantage on gold and some consumables, but overall their damage suffers in the long play.

I feel like you don't understand what is being said here, and remember, that games are shorter, so this is fine.

>Where thunderlords was simply hit three attacks, this is hit three attacks within a time limit.

you really have no idea, it's the same fucking thing.

it's almost the same thing, but some champions that relied on actives or specific combinations to proc thunderlords, are having a harder time using electrocute. For instance, an unupgraded tiamat can't be used as part of the 3 hits for a shaco combo with thunderlords/electrocute, you really do need to get 2 autos and an e off, whereas dark harvest, whilst alot less damage earlygame, is a far better mid/lategame keystone, not because it's more damage since mid-late the damage is only slightly better, but more because lategame you need quicker damage if you want to be better at making picks.

Another example is victor q can't count for all 3 hits for electrocute, it only counts as 2 now, or renektons empowered w, you need to hit an e and a q as well. Similarly gragas can't get electrocute off with only a w-e combo, he needs to either attack a second time, spam q or ult and hope his enemy can't dash away before he gets his third 'hit' off.

to be fair, they removed the interactions that should never have been a part of it.

I remember when just using E on Ekko could cause all 3 damage procs and instantly trigger thunderlords, and that wasn't a good form of gameplay (especially since the way it was done, mid laners would always be half health, off something they can't physically dodge.).

yeah but why can't some item actives proc thunderlords? Shaco's fast combo (not much of a combo, literally just firing e before getting the backstab crit, so that the e lands just after you finish cancelling the last bit of your first auto with tiamat) doesn't proc electrocute, and so it's very awkward as someone who likes to swap between electrocute for earlygame vs dark harvest for games where either the game will go for longer, or the enemy teamcomp has lanes that would be easy to camp, or a jungler I can counterjungle, or I'm just higher ranked than the other players due to weird matchmaking.

I think it was just a side effect of removing Sheen/hextech revolver proc's out of the calculations.

It was just a removal of ALL extra's, you needing the extra hit, is probably more a fault in the champion then a fault in thunderlords having been changed.
Aka let's go play PUBG or Overwatch for a while
How come they not doing away with the ranking  atm? I thought they do in pre season...

Here's a bit more proof to why even though it's pre season and even though "It's a work in progress". This season is not very player friendly. 

(https://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/OC1/195485392/201189745?tab=overview)

 I can see people going "You went late game vs a vayne" 

Yes, i understand that but she has a negative kill score which ends up meaning her ability to come back from behind is just silly.
 I'm the Darius OK, my build is about being a tank for my team against 3 ad users and 2 ap as going full damage doesn't do anything but show that this is how the game is going. Level 1-5. I win against riven and decide go for {{item:3742}} . Could have gone damage with cleaver sure but then i lose cause her damage is stronger.

 Come back to lane with {{item:1031}} and then riven hits 6. All my Armour and all my survivability the moment she gets her ult. From that point onward, I need to play safe against her or die. Bit of a lose lose if you ask me. If you try to engage, I hit shield and lose all my damage or she dashes with her 40% cd and dodges all my skill shots. Once 15 minutes hit, She has her {{item:3071}} which therefore negates my{{item:3047}} {{item:3742}} and what other Armour i have at that time.

Then the rest of game goes and the history shows. I get melted even with all my resistances cause "Lethality is fair" and "Armour % reduction is balanced" On certain picks. IT completely shatters the idea of a balanced. 

And DON'T even get me started on "Supports" brand, fiddles and even annie in some cases, I also forgot to add "Support mf" who is a promient pick this season as the ult is full ad on-hit stack and does a buttttttload of damage even with no damage items. 

Sometimes they get support items for the team and then sometimes they f that and just go "Ap carry number 2" While it's hypocritical to say it when I've got an ad ezreal on my team but at least he goes{{item:2301}} for sight. This is just one of the many games I've had since the beginning of season 8. Where if you don't pick something that can 100-0 in 2 seconds flat, or has something EXTREMELY gimmicky. E.g. {{champion:120}} and predator. You just simply aren't going to win.
